required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of HemoStyp as an Adjunct for Management of Secondary Hemostasis in the Operative Setting
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Safety of HemoStyp as an Adjunct for Management of Secondary Hemostasis in the Operative Setting

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to assess efficacy and safety of HemoStyp as an adjunct for management of secondary hemostasis in the operative setting.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is a prospective, non-inferiority, multi-center, randomized, open-label trial to compare HemoStyp with SurgicelÂ® in the management of bleeding during surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: The Time to Hemostasis Measured From Start of Study Treatment to the Achievement of Hemostasis at the Target Bleeding Site (TBS), or to the End of the 10-minute Observation Period.
primary_outcome.description: The time to hemostasis was measured from start of study treatment to the achievement of hemostasis at the target bleeding site (TBS), or to the end of the 10-minute observation period. The time to hemostasis was considered as censored at the end of the 10-minute observation period. Time to hemostasis was quantified in minutes according to its nominal time point. When re-bleeding occurred, and the cessation of bleeding is again achieved at a later time point, the effective time to hemostasis was the latter time point. The time to hemostasis was the time from start of study treatment to that last effective hemostatic time point.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects Achieving Hemostasis Between 2 Minutes and 10 Minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of subjects achieving hemostasis at the target bleeding site at 2 minutes, 5 minutes and 10 minutes following the start of study treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of Subjects Achieving Intraoperative Hemostasis at the Target Bleeding Site
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of subjects with intraoperative hemostasis at the target bleeding site during the intraoperative period. The intraoperative period started when the first cut was made to the patient and ended when the operative field was closed and dressed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of Subjects With Intraoperative Re-bleeding From the Target Bleeding Site
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of subjects with intraoperative re-bleeding from the target bleeding site post hemostasis

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of Subjects Requiring Surgical Re-exploration up to 30 Days After Surgery for Re-bleeding From the Target Bleeding Site
secondary_outcome.description: Postoperative re-bleeding from the target bleeding site requiring surgical re exploration up to 30 days after surgery.

arm_group.description: Subjects with an appropriate target bleeding site will have Hemostyp applied in accordance to instructions for use.
Subjects with an appropriate target bleeding site will have Surgicel applied in accordance to instructions for use.

intervention.description: During elective surgical procedure (non-laparoscopic thoracic, cardiac, abdominal, or vascular surgery) subject has mild to moderate soft tissue, vascular or parenchymal bleeding present at target bleeding site after primary standard conventional surgical hemostatic methods are proven to be ineffective or impractical will have Hemostyp applied in accordance to instructions for use.

During elective surgical procedure (non-laparoscopic thoracic, cardiac, abdominal, or vascular surgery) subject has mild to moderate soft tissue, vascular or parenchymal bleeding present at target bleeding site after primary standard conventional surgical hemostatic methods are proven to be ineffective or impractical will have Surgicel applied in accordance to instructions for use.

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: Platelet Count
measure.units: platelets per micro liter of blood

measure.title: Lewis Bleeding Scale Grade
measure.description: Investigator rated the intensity of the bleeding at the target bleeding site (TBS) according to the validated bleeding scale (Lewis 2017) shown below. Lewis Bleeding Scale Description: Grade 1 is an ooze or intermittent flow with capillary-like bleeding, described as mild bleeding with >1.0-5.0 milliliters per minutes (ML/Min) blood loss. Grade 2 is a continuous flow, venule and arteriolar-like bleeding described as moderate bleeding with >5.0-10.0 ML/Min blood loss

outcome.title: The Time to Hemostasis Measured From Start of Study Treatment to the Achievement of Hemostasis at the Target Bleeding Site (TBS), or to the End of the 10-minute Observation Period.

When re-bleeding occurred, and the cessation of bleeding is again achieved at a later time point, the effective time to hemostasis was the latter time point. The time to hemostasis was the time from start of study treatment to that last effective hemostatic time point.

outcome.title: Rate of Subjects With Intraoperative Re-bleeding From the Target Bleeding Site
outcome.description: Percentage of subjects with intraoperative re-bleeding from the target bleeding site post hemostasis
outcome.population: 6 subjects in the Surgicel cohort could not be analyzed because hemostasis was never obtained at the target bleeding site.

measure.title: Rate of Subjects With Intraoperative Re-bleeding From the Target Bleeding Site
measure.description: Percentage of subjects with intraoperative re-bleeding from the target bleeding site post hemostasis
measure.population: 6 subjects in the Surgicel cohort could not be analyzed because hemostasis was never obtained at the target bleeding site.

outcome.title: Rate of Subjects Requiring Surgical Re-exploration up to 30 Days After Surgery for Re-bleeding From the Target Bleeding Site
outcome.description: Postoperative re-bleeding from the target bleeding site requiring surgical re exploration up to 30 days after surgery.
outcome.population: 3 subjects in the HemoStyp cohort and 6 subjects in the Surgicel cohort did not finish the 30 day follow up so they were not included in the analysis population.

event.description: Patient had pneumonia requiring hospitalization, not related to the study treatment.
Necrotizing soft tissue infection at site of surgery, requiring abdominal wall debridement. Not related to the study treatment.
Seroma not related to the study treatment.
Abdominal pain that resolved. Not related to the study treatment.
Constipation not related to the study treatment.
Pelvic Pain resolved, not related to the study treatment.
Bleeding of anterior venous fistula, not in the area of the treatment and not related to the study device.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Gerard Abate, MD Chief Medical Officer
